p: Thus, the water phase itself contains only a minor portion of the microorganisms in the oil reservoir and can only constitute a proxy for the true community composition. The oil phase contains another part of the microbial communities, most likely containing attached microbes and those present in small water droplets dispersed in the oil [ 9, 27]. Thus, at least the two phases, water and oil, should be analyzed to obtain a better picture of the true microbial community composition.
